description: These objects are used to monitor/manage changed OSPF neighbor alarm parameters.

event.Summary: OSPFv2 neighbor unavailable due to $v7

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfV2NeighborUnavailable OSPF-MIB::ospfRouterId a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrAddressLessIndex i 9999 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrRtrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2VpnName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrChgReason i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this
should default to the value of one of the
router's IP interface addresses.
This object is persistent and when written
the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfRouterId

description: The IP address this neighbor is using in its
IP source address. Note that, on addressless
links, this will not be 0.0.0.0 but the
address of another of the neighbor's interfaces.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrIpAddr

description: On an interface having an IP address, zero.
On addressless interfaces, the corresponding
value of ifIndex in the Internet Standard MIB.
On row creation, this can be derived from the
instance.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrAddressLessIndex

description: A 32-bit integer (represented as a type
IpAddress) uniquely identifying the neighboring
router in the Autonomous System.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrRtrId

description: The name of the OSPF interface associated with this neighbor.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName

description: The name of VPN instance to which the process belongs.
The process instance needs to be specified when the process is created
and then cannot be changed.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2VpnName

description: The reason of the OSPF neighbor state change.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrChgReason

description: These objects are used to monitor/manage changed OSPF neighbor clear alarm parameters.

event.Summary: OSPFv2 neighbor available

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfV2NeighborUnavailableClear OSPF-MIB::ospfRouterId a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrAddressLessIndex i 9999 OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrRtrId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2VpnName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrChgReason i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this
should default to the value of one of the
router's IP interface addresses.
This object is persistent and when written
the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

description: The IP address this neighbor is using in its
IP source address. Note that, on addressless
links, this will not be 0.0.0.0 but the
address of another of the neighbor's interfaces.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrIpAddr

description: On an interface having an IP address, zero.
On addressless interfaces, the corresponding
value of ifIndex in the Internet Standard MIB.
On row creation, this can be derived from the
instance.

description: A 32-bit integer (represented as a type
IpAddress) uniquely identifying the neighboring
router in the Autonomous System.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrRtrId

description: The name of the OSPF interface associated with this neighbor.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName

description: The name of VPN instance to which the process belongs.
The process instance needs to be specified when the process is created
and then cannot be changed.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2VpnName

description: The reason of the OSPF neighbor state change.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrChgReason

description: The object is used to monitor router ID conflict in an intra area.

event.Summary: Intra area router ID conflict detected

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2IntraAreaRouteridConflict HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfRouterId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrRouterId a 192.0.2.1

description: This object indicates the 32-bit integer that uniquely identifies the router in the Autonomous System.
It is the router ID of itself.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfRouterId

description: This object indicates the router ID of this neighbor.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NbrRouterId

description: The object is used to monitor conflicted IP addresses of DRs in an intra area.

event.Summary: Intra area DRs IP address conflict detected

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2IntraAreaDRIpAddressConflict HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfRouterId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName s EXAMPLE OSPF-MIB::ospfLsdbLsid a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfLsdbRouterId a 192.0.2.1

description: This object indicates the 32-bit integer that uniquely identifies the router in the Autonomous System.
It is the router ID of itself.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfRouterId

description: This object indicates the IP address of the OSPF interface associated with this neighbor.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfIpAddress

description: The name of the OSPF interface associated with this neighbor.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2SelfIfName

description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field
containing either a Router ID or an IP address;
it identifies the piece of the routing domain
that is being described by the advertisement.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfLsdbLsid

description: The 32-bit number that uniquely identifies the
originating router in the Autonomous System.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfLsdbRouterId

description: The object is used to monitor router ID conflict recovery in an intra area.

event.Summary: Intra area router ID conflict resolved

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2IntraAreaRouterIdConflictRecovered HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2ProcessIdIndex u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId a 192.0.2.1 OSPF-MIB::ospfRouterId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NewRouterId a 192.0.2.1

description: The process ID indicates the OSPF process number. The value ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2ProcessIdIndex

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifies an area.
Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this
should default to the value of one of the
router's IP interface addresses.
This object is persistent and when written
the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.
variables.name: OSPF-MIB::ospfRouterId

description: This object indicates the 32-bit integer that uniquely identifies the router in the Autonomous System.
It is the new router ID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2NewRouterId

description: The object is used to monitor the peer flapping-suppress status of interface in ospfv2.

event.Summary: OSPFv2 flap suppression changed to $v4 due to $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PeerFlappingSuppressStatusChange HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2ProcessIdIndex u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2InterfaceName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PeerFlappingSuppressStatus i 2 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PeerFlappingSuppressReason i 1

description: The process ID indicates the OSPF process number. The value ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2ProcessIdIndex

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifies an area.
Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId

description: The name of the OSPF interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2InterfaceName

description: The suppress status of peer flapping.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PeerFlappingSuppressStatus

description: The reason of peer flapping suppress status change.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PeerFlappingSuppressReason

description: This object indicates that the number of AS-external LSAs generated when an OSPF process imports external routes exceeds the configured alarm threshold.

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifies an area.
Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.
variables.name: HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId

description: This object indicates that OSPF routes advertised by the local device were deleted by another device,
and the possibly faulty device did not support OSPF flush LSA source trace. Log in to the possibly faulty device.
If the device is deleting routes, reset or isolate it from the network. Otherwise, check other devices.
Neither of the devices displayed in the display ospf purge-source-trace analysis-info command output is the faulty device.

event.Summary: OSPFv2 route deleted by purge inexact

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2RouteBeDeletedByPurgeInexact HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2ProcessIdIndex u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PurgeHostName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PurgeIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PurgeRouterId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AreaId a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2FlushLsaNum u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2AffectedNodeNum u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2TotalNodeNum u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2RuledOutDeviceNum u 9999 HUAWEI-OSPFV2-MIB::hwOspfv2PurgeStatPeriod u 9999
